main event: A pilot observed a light, sky-blue circular object crossing his path while flying over Cartersville, Georgia, on January 9, 1948.
interesting points: The object was described as having an 'intense blue' color and was witnessed for about 2 minutes at an altitude of 3,000 feet., The pilot compared the object's flame to 'buzz bombs' from WWII experienced by RAF pilots., Several other pilots reportedly saw the object during the same flight but could provide no further identification., Thereâ€™s an investigation into possible connections between the sighting and the deaths of 75 cattle nearby., The report indicated no evidence of jet aircraft in the vicinity during that time.
witness description: pilot of Eastern Airlines and purser
